Articles.Content:
34 minutes ago, Galileo said:

This is probably why I didn't see this issue.  Before I even started up ksp with kopernicus I downloaded the latest ModularFlightIntegrator which apparently fixed the issue. 

Dammit... Expect 1.2.0-2 soon then.

And its there

Edited October 20, 2016 by Thomas P.
OMGYESTHANKYOUOMG!!!
Very nice. Thanks for all the hard work Thomas and colleagues!
Yay! Thanks for the update.

Another v1.2 mod essential checked off the list...

Didn't see anything in the source or configs so @Thomas P. (or anyone else) is it possible to control the range at which scatter is loaded? Would love to be able to see more of the forest of trees that exists out on the grasslands west of KSC from KSC. They don't even load when I fly out there from KSC, I have to load to a craft that is sitting in the region for the trees to appear then hop back along a series of crafts I placed to get to KSC with the trees still loaded in the distance. The new v1.2 physics.cfg load distance settings will make this easier since I won't have to string out crafts every 2km. But still.
Okay, man, may I upload my mod, why am I asking? The license from the Gas Planet's texture.

On 10/19/2016 at 5:52 PM, Galileo said:

awesome! this quote is stuck here and i don't know why and it won't let me type outside or delete it. really annoying.

2 minutes ago, Specific Alduin said:
On 10/19/2016 at 5:52 PM, Galileo said:

awesome! this quote is stuck here and i don't know why and it won't let me type outside or delete it. really annoying.

I'm having a problem. I'm trying to make some particles for a planet, so I tried out the particles example. However, it doesn't seem to be affecting Minmus at all. I've placed it in the Kopernicus folder as instructed, but I'm not getting any luck. What am I doing wrong? Thanks!

Having a bit of an issue with a planet.. Making the normals .dds makes it look like there is mesh covering the entire planet. Making the height and colors .dds makes it black. here is the .cfg Also in PQS view it did this.

Spoiler

@Kopernicus:AFTER[Kopernicus]
{
    Body
    {
         name = Sulphie
         cacheFile = TestPlanetPack/Cache/Sulphie.bin
         Template
         {
             name = Duna
             removeAllPQSMods = true
         }
         Properties
         {
            description = Sulphie, as implied by it's name, has sulphur. And a lot of it. The atmosphere consists mostly of sulphur dioxide, with some oxygen. We think life exists here, because it has some green stuff on the surface.
            radius = 420000
            geeASL = 0.3
            isHomeWorld = false
            tidallyLocked = false
            rotationPeriod = 42154.7
            timewarpAltitudeLimits = 0 30000 30000 60000 100000 300000 600000 800000
            ScienceValues
            {
                landedDataValue = 8
                splashedDataValue = 1
                flyingLowDataValue = 5
                flyingHighDataValue = 5
                inSpaceLowDataValue = 7
                inSpaceHighDataValue = 5
                recoveryValue = 5
                flyingAltitudeThreshold = 12000
                spaceAltitudeThreshold = 160000
            }

         }
         ScaledVersion
         {
            type = Atmospheric
            fadeStart = 95000
            fadeEnd = 97000
            Material
            {
                texture = TestPlanetPack/PluginData/Sulphiecolors.png
                normals = TestPlanetPack/PluginData/Sulphienormals.dds
                shininess = 0
                specular = 0,0,0,1
                rimPower = 2.06
                rimBlend = 0.3
                Gradient
                {
                    0.0 = 0.8,0.8,0.375,1

                }
            }
         }
         Atmosphere
         {
             ambientColor = 1,1,0.4,1
             enabled = true
             oxygen = true
             altitude = 42000.0
             pressureCurve

I'm pretty sure this effect is not caused by your cfg but likely the way you are saving your textures. What program are you using? 

 

And are you on Linux or a Mac by chance? If so,  does changing your textures to png get rid of the "mesh"?  

Edited October 21, 2016 by Galileo

Yaaaaaaaayyyyyyy!! , finally, i can use warpdrives for interstellar travel in ksp 1.2!!!

I doesn't had updated from 1.1.2 to 1.2 by the mod-compatibility loss.

QUESTION 1- I can reparent Kerbin or the Sun safely without using principia?

QUESTION 2- It can load mods for ksp 1.1.2 and Kopernicus 1.0.4 like Galactic Neighborhood or New Horizons?

 My computer is 4GB RAM. It has problems with loading .png files.

Please can fix .dds texture bug?

Edited October 21, 2016 by EnriqueB

1 hour ago, EnriqueB said:

Yaaaaaaaayyyyyyy!! , finally, i can use warpdrives for interstellar travel in ksp 1.2!!!

I doesn't had updated from 1.1.2 to 1.2 by the mod-compatibility loss.

QUESTION 1- I can reparent Kerbin or the Sun safely without using principia?

QUESTION 2- It can load mods for ksp 1.1.2 and Kopernicus 1.0.4 like Galactic Neighborhood or New Horizons?

 My computer is 4GB RAM. It has problems with loading .png files.

Please can fix .dds texture bug?

ANSWER 1. Kopernicus can do that, but: the Sun is a static object AFAIK, still, moving it will cause a ton of glitches. The same goes for Kerbin, reparenting Kerbin will result in orbital calculations issues and solar panel issues iirc.

ANSWER 2. Not neccesarily. Kopernicus will work fine, but some parts of planet mods will need to be tweaked for optimizations. If these updates to Kopernicus-using mods haven't happened in a while, they may cause issues. Therefore I wouldn't risk planet packs for KSP versions below 1.0

That shouldn't happen. It's likely a problem with your graphics drivers, the RAM memory is like the short term memory of a computer, it has nothing to do with loading/unloading textures iirc. Is this PNG loading issue only for KSP? Because in that case it could be OnDemandLoading, thus an incorrect install of Kopernicus could be the cause, or a problem with the GPU of your PC prevents ODL from working properly. We need more info to work with here, sorry.

And what .dds texture bug are you talking about?
Thank you so much for updating to 1.2!!!!!!
Another question: does KittopiaTech still work? I'm not having any success on my end.

8 hours ago, Galileo said:

I'm pretty sure this effect is not caused by your cfg but likely the way you are saving your textures. What program are you using? 

 

And are you on Linux or a Mac by chance? If so,  does changing your textures to png get rid of the "mesh"?  

I'm on Linux, using space engine. I will have to check the png thing. Exporting as png makes my colormap transparent for some reason. I can fix this by converting the image formats.

Edited October 21, 2016 by Specific Alduin

53 minutes ago, Specific Alduin said:

I'm on Linux, using space engine. I will have to check the png thing. Exporting as png makes my colormap transparent for some reason. I can fix this by converting the image formats.

Tried making the textures png and it ended up fixing the mesh type issue, but the pqs view is still square-ey.

Edited October 21, 2016 by Specific Alduin

Hi Thomas,

  Just want to say thanks for making such a great plugin. I came by today to find 1.2 because KSP just isn't the same without Kopernicus and the various planet mods that are possible because of it. I read your description about how much you enjoyed making it and the comment about people not really donating. While it's great that you do it for the love of it and not for money, I signed up with Patreon for $2/month anyway. It's not much, but imagine if everyone who used your plugin gave even just $1/month, it would be a nice way for people to say thanks for adding so much to a game we all love. I only post here in the hopes of encouraging others to give even a little bit as a way for our community to give back a little to those who have given us so much.

  So on behalf of myself and the other Patreon's currently totaling your $9/month - enjoy your free Starbucks this month on us! At least it's a little something to say thanks!

I think I found your problem...using two different image formats (.png and .dds) in the ScaledVersion section may be screwing up the way Sulphie loads. Also, you don't have VertexColorMap in you config. Without it the planet's color map in flight mode is going to be messed up.

4 hours ago, ProtoJeb21 said:

I think I found your problem...using two different image formats (.png and .dds) in the ScaledVersion section may be screwing up the way Sulphie loads. Also, you don't have VertexColorMap in you config. Without it the planet's color map in flight mode is going to be messed up.

The scaledspace view is pretty good now, I'm not sure exactly how PQS mods work so having a tutorial reviewing those would be helpful. I will look up that PQS mod and see how to use it. When I said "Making the height and colors .dds makes it black." I meant that all the textures were .dds
